intro: Maytenus jefeana, commonly known as the Jefeana mayten, is a shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
